attributes.action: Lower the smear test age to 21
attributes.additional_details: Once girls/women become sexually active, they can get HPV (human papillomavirus) which is very common. For some people, the virus goes away by itself. For many, the virus makes cells abnormal which can develop into cervical cancer. If treated early, this may be easily treatable. However if left until the age of 25, these cells can turn into high grade dyskaryosis / CIN3 (the stage before cancer) or cervical cancer. You should be able to have a smear test from when you are sexually active.
attributes.background: Lower the smear test screening age to 21 or lower

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580043
